intro: Zanonia indica subsp. indica, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Zanonia indica subsp. indica is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
